xyz.acygn.mokapot

Class LengthIndependent

  • java.lang.Object
    • xyz.acygn.mokapot.LengthIndependent

  • public class LengthIndependent
extends Object
    Redefinitions of Java's primitive operations to treat long references and short references the same way. Some of Java's most fundamental operations, such as the == operator, are coded without the use of method calls on their operands. This means that long references cannot transfer the method call onto the original object, as there's no method call to transfer. This class contains reimplementations of these operations that correctly handle both long and short references.
    Author:
    Alex Smith

    • Method Detail

      • referenceEquals

        public static boolean referenceEquals(Object a,
                                      Object b)
        Checks to see whether two references reference the same object.

        This method can correctly compare a short reference to a long reference. In most cases, the use of == will be sufficient (two long references, or two short references, can be correctly compared via the use of == directly); it's rare to have both a long and a short reference to the same object. This situation can, however, occur if the object previously existed on another VM and has since migrated to the current VM, or if the long reference was created manually, and thus this length-independent wrapper is needed for correctness in all cases.

        Parameters:
        a - The first reference to compare.
        b - The second reference to compare.
        Returns:
        true if a and b are both null or both reference the same object; false otherwise

      • getActualClass

        public static <T> Class<? extends T> getActualClass(T ref)
                                             throws NullPointerException
        Determines the actual class of the object a given reference references.
        Type Parameters:
        T - A declared class for the object. Can just be ? or Object to emulate the functionality of Object#getClass.
        Parameters:
        ref - A reference.
        Returns:
        The actual class of the object referenced by ref.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - If ref is null
        See Also:
        Object.getClass()

      • isInstanceOf

        public static boolean isInstanceOf(Object o,
                                   Class<?> c)
        Returns whether the object referenced by a given reference extends the given class or implements the given interface. This is similar to the Java operator instanceof, but works on long references.
        Parameters:
        o - The object to check.
        c - The class or interface.
        Returns:
        true if the object referenced by o implements or extends c.
